title: Escalating Protests in Minnesota: Leaders Urge Calm Amid Federal Threats
summary: In Minnesota, protests escalated as demonstrators clashed with ICE agents following an incident where a man was shot and wounded after allegedly assaulting federal officers. Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey called for calmer reactions on the streets to de-escalate tensions. Concurrently, President Trump intensified threats to deploy U.S. troops to the Twin Cities under the Insurrection Act, an 18th-century law permitting presidential use of the military when local authorities cannot maintain order, last invoked during the 1992 Rodney King riots in Los Angeles. Governor Tim Walz urged the president to lower the temperature and avoid further militarization. The protests reignited overnight, highlighting ongoing conflicts over immigration enforcement and civil unrest. Leaders are navigating a delicate balance between ensuring public safety and respecting protest rights, with federal intervention looming as a potential response to perceived instability.
